content: Current guidelines generally recommend prophylactic amiodarone for POAF; however, recommendations are vague and unspecified regarding timing of initiation, specific cardiac surgery patient populations, and dosing regimens (Table 1). The 2019 ACC/AHA/ESC Guidelines note that preoperative amiodarone is reasonable as prophylactic therapy for “high risk” patients, although these recommendations are not further defined, leaving room for interpretation and practice variations

title: Amiodarone prophylaxis against postoperative atrial fibrillation in off-pump coronary artery bypass
